title: John Leamy (hurler)
text:
John Leamy (born 1964) is an Irish retired <a href="hurling">hurler</a>. His <a href="National%20Hurling%20League">league</a> and <a href="All-Ireland%20Senior%20Hurling%20Championship">championship</a> career with the <a href="Tipperary%20GAA">Tipperary</a> senior team in the late eighties and early nineties saw him winning 2 Munster Senior Medals and 1 All Ireland. 
Leamy first appeared for the <a href="Golden-Kilfeacle%20GAA">Golden-Kilfeacle</a> club at juvenile and underage levels, before eventually joining the club's adult team. After winning five divisional intermediate championship medals, he won a <a href="Tipperary%20Intermediate%20Hurling%20Championship">county intermediate championship</a> medal in 1995.
Leamy made his debut on the inter-county scene when he was selected for the Tipperary minor team. He enjoyed two championship seasons with the minor team, culminating with the winning of an <a href="All-Ireland%20Minor%20Hurling%20Championship">All-Ireland</a> medal in 1982. Leamy subsequently joined the under-21 team, winning an <a href="All-Ireland%20Under-21%20Hurling%20Championship">All-Ireland</a> medal in 1985 while also playing for the county junior team. He joined the senior team during the <a href="1988%20All-Ireland%20Senior%20Hurling%20Championship">1988 championship</a>. Over the course of the next number of seasons Leamy was the second-choice goalkeeper and won an <a href="All-Ireland%20Senior%20Hurling%20Championship">All-Ireland</a> medal as a substitute in 1989. He also won two <a href="Munster%20Senior%20Hurling%20Championship">Munster</a> medals. Leamy ended his inter-county career with the Tipperary intermediate team in 1995.
